results.title: [Rice growing and distribution in Australia]
results.brief_description: Silent film showing the process of rice growing in Australia and its storage and distribution. Printed shot-list accompanying the film indicates “Victorian Railways” and suggested script. Silent film with no title, intertitles or credits. To quote from the shot-list “…Rice is grown under irrigation in the Murrumbidgee, Coleambally and Murray Valley districts of NSW and, near Townsville in Queensland. From a humble beginning, the industry has prospered, reaching a production of 284,000 tons of rice harvested in 1971. The average yield of Australian rice is the highest in the world 3 tons of grain per acre.”

results.title: [Return to Michigan]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Week”.
In 1976, tragedy struck the farmers at Michigan. A poisonous chemical, PBB, had been mixed into stock food, and all livestock had to be killed and the contamination was passed on through foods for human consumption causing much illness.

results.title: [Remix: Women in science and technology]
results.brief_description:
This remix is a short film celebrating women in professional roles, including science, technology, aviation, mechanics and farming, sourced from footage in the ACMI Collection.

ACMI gratefully acknowledges the following donors and creators in the compilation of this work: Dried Fruits Australia, Cargill Australia, Australian Wool Innovation Ltd., Rio Tinto, Elenor Peach, Yolanta Simmonds, Dept. of Employment, John Richardson, Wine Australia and Ivan Gaal.

results.title: [Remix: Transport]
results.brief_description: This short film is a remix of archival footage from the ACMI Collection, focusing on public transport in Victoria. The remix contains footage of trams, trains, Flinders Street Station and city streets in Melbourne.

results.title: [Remix: 1956 Melbourne Olympic Games]
results.brief_description:
This remix features footage of the 1956 Melbourne Olympic Games including the Olympic torch relay, opening ceremony at the MCG, various events and some elaborate decorations displayed in the CBD during the games.

The video was made using clips from home movies and professional documentary footage preserved in the ACMI Collection.
